title: Electric PE - work on 1 nC and 2 nC point charges

content.description: A system is comprised of two positive point charges, which have charge values of <math alttext="1 nanocoulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 nanocoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math>. How does the amount of work done on the system by an external force or forces compare for the following three scenarios?
content.question: Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>: <math alttext="W sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is the work done by an external force to move the <math alttext="1 nanocoulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> point charge from far away to a distance of <math alttext="1 centimeter" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> from the <math alttext="2 nanocoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> point charge, which is fixed in place. Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>: <math alttext="W sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is the work done by an external force to move the <math alttext="2 nanocoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> point charge from far away to a distance of <math alttext="1 centimeter" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> from the <math alttext="1 nanocoulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> point charge, which is fixed in place. Scenario <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>: <math alttext="W sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> is the total work done by external forces to move both point charges simultaneously from far away to locations that are a distance of <math alttext="1 centimeter" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> from each other. In each scenario, the initial positions of any point charges that get moved can be considered to be infinitely far away.
